verses.roman:
balaṁ ca kaṁsa-prahitaṁ
hatvā śālā-mukhāt tataḥ
niṣkramya ceratur hṛṣṭau
nirīkṣya pura-sampadaḥ

synonyms: balam—an armed force; ca—and; kaṁsa-prahitam—sent by Kaṁsa; hatvā—having killed; śālā—of the sacrificial arena; mukhāt—by the gate; tataḥ—then; niṣkramya—exciting; ceratuḥ—the two of Them walked along; hṛṣṭau—happy; nirīkṣya—observing; pura—of the city; sampadaḥ—the riches.
translation: After also killing a contingent of soldiers sent by Kaṁsa, Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma left the sacrificial arena by its main gate and continued Their walk about the city, happily looking at the opulent sights.
